data.title: Check out the great Mural
data.text: If you are in Halo Burgers drive up window on Saginaw street check out the mural on the wall next door.  It is a reminder of when Vernor's was the number one drink of choice.  I still love it in Boston coolers.

data.title: A downtown stable
data.text:
Driving south on Saginaw, it's hard to miss this old and beautiful mural. Vernors, a Michigan original, for years was held close to the hearts of many wandered downtown. 

While faded, it's majestic appeal still invites young and old to wonder and dream.

data.title: A flint landmark
data.text: Love seeing the Vernor's Mural. It is on the side of the Greater Flint Arts Council. It has been artfully restored many times over the years.

data.title: It is one of Michigan's greatest murals
data.text:
Vernor's is a big part of michigan's heritage so go see it.
Very nostalgic feelings will come over you.

data.title: Pokemon Hunting
data.text: It's a mural...that is also a pokestop...if you go here make sure to stop into Halo Burger...because seven days without a Halo Burger makes one weak. :)

data.title: Flint History
data.text: When we first moved to Genesee County and traveled to downtown Flint we used to eat at the Halo Burger next to the mural. We would enjoy an olive burger and admire the whimsical mural painted long ago. I remember when the building the mural is painted on caught fire. The building came very close to being demolished. Nice to see that The Flint Arts Council was able to purchase the building and make sure this Flint icon will remain. We drive by it at least once during our summer visit to Michigan.

data.title: This mural is an important part of Flint's history
data.text: I always enjoy looking at the Vernor's Mural on the side of the Greater Flint Arts Council building next to the Big Boy drive through.  It's been there since I can remember and I recommend you take time to study it in the daytime.

data.title: It's been updated a bit but still a JOY!
data.text: The real treat is still the drink...Vernor's ginger ale aged in wood, best with cream added in my book, but the mural holds a lot of memories too. Vernor's was made in Detroit and has a very localised marketing region. Here in NZ they have ginger beer but is nothing like ginger ale, though I suspect common ancestry way back when. This is not an artistic marvel but it might keep the kids occupied whilst you down the burgers.

data.title: A Flint landmark
data.text:
Just a bit of Flint history. Been on this wall forever...or so it seems. When this building caught fire several years back there was such a public outcry to save the mural, and it was repaired. 

Easy to view from the comfort (and safety) of your car. Best viewed during daylight hours.

data.title: Across from Halo Burger
data.text: If you go to visit the old Halo Burger on Saginaw Street in downtown Flint, be sure to view the Vernor's Mural across the parking lot to the South (on the North Wall of the GFAC building).  Vernor's Ginger Ale is available to buy (fountain drinks and Boston Coolers) inside Halo Burger, and has a rich history in the area.
